examples.input: The Andromeda Galaxy is approximately 2.537 million light-years from Earth. It is the nearest major galaxy to the Milky Way. It contains about one trillion stars. It's on a collision course with the Milky Way, expected in about 4.5 billion years. It has a supermassive black hole at its center, P3, with a mass of 100 million solar masses. Several dwarf galaxies orbit Andromeda, including M32 and M110. Its apparent magnitude is 3.44, making it visible to the naked eye on dark nights. The Hubble Space Telescope has provided detailed images of its spiral arms and star clusters. Research suggests it has consumed smaller galaxies in its past. Its chemical composition is similar to the Milky Way but with a higher metallicity in its disk. The study of Andromeda helps understand galactic evolution and structure.
examples.response: <memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,distance from Earth,2.537 million light-years</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,is,nearest major galaxy to Milky Way</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,contains,one trillion stars</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,collision course with,Milky Way</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,collision expected in,4.5 billion years</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,has central black hole,P3</memory_write><memory_write>P3,mass,100 million solar masses</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,orbited by,M32</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,orbited by,M110</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,apparent magnitude,3.44</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,visibility,naked eye on dark nights</memory_write><memory_write>Hubble Space Telescope,provided images of,Andromeda Galaxy spiral arms</memory_write><memory_write>Hubble Space Telescope,provided images of,Andromeda Galaxy star clusters</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,consumed,smaller galaxies in past</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,chemical composition,similar to Milky Way</memory_write><memory_write>Andromeda Galaxy,disk metallicity,higher than Milky Way</memory_write><memory_write>Study of Andromeda,helps understand,galactic evolution</memory_write><memory_write>Study of Andromeda,helps understand,galactic structure</memory_write>

examples.input: The new global initiative 'Clean Oceans Project' aims to reduce plastic pollution by 80% by 2040. It involves 50 countries and 200 NGOs. Key strategies include developing biodegradable plastics, improving waste management systems in coastal cities, funding ocean cleanup technologies, and running global awareness campaigns. The project's budget is $5 billion over 10 years, primarily funded by a consortium of governments and private foundations. Dr. Elena Petrova is the project director. What are the specific targets for the first 5 years and which corporations are major private funders?

Also, what are the current conservation statuses and threats?

examples.input: The company 'Innovatech Solutions' is launching a new product line 'SynergyAI'. This line includes three main products: 'SynergyAnalyst' for data analytics, 'SynergyCreator' for content generation, and 'SynergyGuard' for cybersecurity. These products leverage a proprietary neural network architecture called 'NovaNet'. 'NovaNet' was developed over 5 years by a team of 50 researchers led by Dr. Anya Sharma. 'SynergyAI' products are subscription-based, with three tiers: Basic, Pro, and Enterprise. The Basic tier for 'SynergyAnalyst' costs $49/month. The Pro tier for 'SynergyCreator' includes advanced features like multi-language support and team collaboration, priced at $199/month. 'SynergyGuard' Enterprise tier offers dedicated support and custom threat intelligence feeds. Innovatech Solutions was founded in 2015 by Johnathan Lee and Sarah Chen. Its headquarters is in San Francisco. They previously launched 'DataMine Pro' which was acquired by 'BigData Corp' in 2020. The 'SynergyAI' line aims to capture 15% of the AI-powered business solutions market within 3 years. Pre-orders for 'SynergyAI' products will open next month, with an official launch in Q3. Early adopters will receive a 20% discount on their first year subscription. The marketing campaign will focus on digital channels and industry conferences.

examples.input: The Artemis program, led by NASA, aims to return humans to the Moon by 2026, with the ultimate goal of establishing a sustainable lunar presence and preparing for human missions to Mars. Key international partners include ESA, JAXA, and CSA. The program involves the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and the Orion spacecraft. Artemis I was an uncrewed test flight. Artemis II will be the first crewed mission, orbiting the Moon. Artemis III will land astronauts near the lunar south pole, a region believed to contain water ice. The program also includes the Gateway, a small space station in lunar orbit, to support surface missions. What are the specific scientific objectives for the Artemis III mission, what is the planned duration of the surface EVA, and what are the main challenges for establishing a sustainable lunar base?
examples.response: <memory_ask>Information about Artemis program</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,led by,NASA</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,aims to,return humans to Moon</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,target year for Moon return,2026</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,ultimate goal,establish sustainable lunar presence</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,ultimate goal,prepare for human missions to Mars</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,key international partner,ESA</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,key international partner,JAXA</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,key international partner,CSA</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,involves,Space Launch System (SLS)</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,involves,Orion spacecraft</memory_ask><memory_ask>Information about Artemis I mission</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis I mission,was,uncrewed test flight</memory_ask><memory_ask>Information about Artemis II mission</emory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis II mission,will be,first crewed mission orbiting Moon</memory_ask><memory_ask>Information about Artemis III mission</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis III mission,will land astronauts near,lunar south pole</memory_ask><memory_ask>Lunar south pole,believed to contain,water ice</memory_ask><memory_ask>Artemis program,includes,Gateway lunar space station</memory_ask><memory_ask>Gateway lunar space station,purpose,support surface missions</memory_ask><memory_ask>What are the specific scientific objectives for Artemis III mission</memory_ask><memory_ask>What is the planned duration of Artemis III surface EVA</memory_ask><memory_ask>What are the main challenges for establishing a sustainable lunar base</memory_ask>

examples.input: Describe the process of cellular respiration in eukaryotic cells, detailing the four main stages (Glycolysis, Pyruvate Oxidation, Citric Acid Cycle, Oxidative Phosphorylation). For each stage, specify its location within the cell, key inputs, key outputs (including ATP, NADH, FADH2 produced), and whether oxygen is required. Also, what is the overall ATP yield from one molecule of glucose under aerobic conditions?

examples.input: The fictional city of 'Aethelgard' is the capital of the 'Kingdom of Eldoria'. It was founded 1000 years ago by King Theron the Great. The city is known for its towering 'Sunspire Citadel', which houses the 'Orb of Lumina', a powerful artifact. Aethelgard's economy relies on 'sky-crystal' mining and trade with the 'Freeports of Aerthos'. The city is protected by the 'Griffin Knights'. The current ruler is Queen Elara. The city's main river is the 'Argent Stream'. Aethelgard has three districts: the Noble Quarter, the Merchant's Guild, and the Commons. The annual 'Festival of Stars' is a major cultural event. The city flag depicts a golden griffin on a blue field. The city motto is 'Lux et Veritas' (Light and Truth). Aethelgard is currently facing a threat from the 'Shadow Blight' encroaching from the 'Whispering Woods'. The 'Council of Mages' is seeking a solution. The city's population is approximately 500,000. Aethelgard has a unique architectural style combining elven and dwarven influences. Its primary exports are refined sky-crystals and enchanted textiles. Its primary imports are rare herbs and exotic fruits from Aerthos. The 'Grand Library of Aethelgard' contains ancient scrolls detailing Eldoria's history. The 'Sunspire Citadel' is 500 meters tall. The 'Orb of Lumina' is said to shine with the light of a captured star. The 'Griffin Knights' ride giant griffins and are led by Commander Valerius. Queen Elara ascended to the throne 10 years ago after her father, King Borin, passed away. The 'Argent Stream' flows from the 'Dragon's Tooth Mountains'. The 'Festival of Stars' celebrates the celestial alignment that occurs once a decade. The 'Shadow Blight' corrupts land and living beings. The 'Whispering Woods' was once a sacred elven forest. The 'Council of Mages' is led by Archmage Lyra. The city's defenses include enchanted walls and magical wards. The 'Noble Quarter' is home to aristocratic families. The 'Merchant's Guild' controls most trade. The 'Commons' is the largest residential area. Aethelgard's currency is the 'Eldorian Crown'. The city has a complex sewer system rumored to hide ancient secrets. The 'Sky-crystals' are mined from floating islands above Aethelgard. The 'Freeports of Aerthos' are a loose confederation of island city-states. Aethelgard's main rival is the 'Iron Hegemony' to the north. The city recently signed a trade treaty with the 'Sylvandell Elves'. The 'Grand Library' was founded by Scholar Elmsworth 300 years ago. The 'Sunspire Citadel' has 100 levels. The 'Orb of Lumina' is guarded by three ancient constructs. Commander Valerius is known for his bravery and tactical genius. Queen Elara is a skilled diplomat. King Borin ruled for 40 years. The 'Dragon's Tooth Mountains' are rich in minerals. The 'Festival of Stars' includes a grand tournament. The 'Shadow Blight' is resistant to most forms of magic. Archmage Lyra is searching for a legendary artifact called the 'Heartstone' to combat the Blight. The enchanted walls of Aethelgard were built by the first king. The 'Eldorian Crown' is made of gold and sky-crystals. The city's water supply comes from the 'Argent Stream'. The 'Iron Hegemony' is known for its powerful war machines.

examples.input: The new cybersecurity framework, 'ZeroTrust v2.0', mandates multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all system access, continuous monitoring of network traffic using AI-driven anomaly detection, and data encryption both in transit (using TLS 1.3) and at rest (using AES-256). It also specifies incident response protocols, including a 1-hour reporting window for critical breaches and a 24-hour window for major incidents. All employees must undergo annual security awareness training. The framework applies to all company assets, including cloud services, on-premise servers, and employee endpoints. The CISO, Dr. Evelyn Reed, is responsible for its implementation. What are the key differences between ZeroTrust v2.0 and its predecessor v1.5, how will compliance be audited, and what are the penalties for non-compliance for different departments?
examples.response: <memory_ask>Information about ZeroTrust v2.0 cybersecurity framework</memory_ask><memory_ask>ZeroTrust v2.0,mandates,multi-factor authentication for all system access</memory_ask><memory_ask>ZeroTrust v2.0,mandates,continuous monitoring of network traffic</memory_ask><memory_ask>Continuous monitoring,uses,AI-driven anomaly detection</memory_ask><memory_ask>ZeroTrust v2.0,mandates,data encryption in transit</memory_ask><memory_ask>Data encryption in transit,uses,TLS 1.3</memory_ask><memory_ask>ZeroTrust v2.0,mandates,data encryption at rest</memory_ask><memory_ask>Data encryption at rest,uses,AES-256</memory_ask><memory_ask>ZeroTrust v2.0,specifies,incident response protocols</memory_ask><memory_ask>Incident response protocol,includes,1-hour reporting window for critical breaches</memory_ask><memory_ask>Incident response protocol,includes,24-hour window for major incidents</memory_ask><memory_ask>ZeroTrust v2.0,requires,annual security awareness training for all employees</memory_ask><memory_ask>ZeroTrust v2.0,applies to,all company assets</memory_ask><memory_ask>Company assets,include,cloud services</memory_ask><memory_ask>Company assets,include,on-premise servers</memory_ask><memory_ask>Company assets,include,employee endpoints</memory_ask><memory_ask>Who is Dr. Evelyn Reed</memory_ask><memory_ask>Dr. Evelyn Reed,is,CISO</memory_ask><memory_ask>Dr. Evelyn Reed,responsible for,ZeroTrust v2.0 implementation</memory_ask><memory_ask>What are the key differences between ZeroTrust v2.0 and ZeroTrust v1.5</memory_ask><memory_ask>How will ZeroTrust v2.0 compliance be audited</memory_ask><memory_ask>What are the penalties for non-compliance with ZeroTrust v2.0 for different departments</memory_ask>
